meanings.definition: Sewing: a stitch made by doubling back on the previous stitch.
meanings.sent1: She reinforced the seam with backstitching.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used backstitching to secure the hem.
meanings.sent3: The backstitching on the dress was so strong, it could probably hold a small elephant!
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was like backstitching, ensuring everything was secure.
meanings.sent5: The backstitching created a neat and durable finish on the fabric.

meanings.definition: Embroidery: a stitch made by sewing backwards.
meanings.sent1: The intricate design was enhanced by the delicate backstitching.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's favorite technique in embroidery was backstitching.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to mimic the backstitching but ended up in a tangle.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was reflected in her embroidery, each backstitching a tribute to the outdoors.
meanings.sent5: The backstitching added depth and texture to the floral pattern.
